recipes.name: Spicy Vegetarian Sopa Azteca (Tortilla Soup) with Ancho, Pasilla & Guajillo Chiles
recipes.notes: We added black beans which gave it a bit of depth. Don’t forget to de-seed the chilis and watch the heat

recipes.name: Vegetarian Sopa Azteca (Tortilla Soup) with Toasted Dried Chili
Thai Green Curry with Tomatoes and Fresh Herbs
recipes.description: A vibrant, aromatic Thai curry featuring your green curry paste with fresh tomatoes, garlic, and cilantro. Served with lime wedges and fresh avocado for creaminess.
recipes.ingredients_available: Green Curry Paste, tomatoes (6 large), garlic (4 cloves), onion (1 medium), fresh cilantro (1/2 cup), lime (2), avocado (2), extra virgin olive oil, salt, pepper, epazote (2 tbsp)
recipes.ingredients_needed: Coconut milk (1 can), vegetable or firm tofu (1 block), bell peppers (2), fresh basil (optional but recommended)
recipes.reason: Uses your Green Curry Paste and fresh herbs perfectly; Thai cuisine matches your request; light and flavorful dinner that's quick to prepare.
recipes.instructions:
1. Heat 2 tablespoons olive oil in a large pot over medium heat
2. Add diced onion (1 medium) and minced garlic (2 cloves), sauté for 2 minutes until fragrant
3. Stir in 4-5 tablespoons Green Curry Paste and cook for 1-2 minutes, stirring constantly
4. Add diced tomatoes (4 cups) and 1 can coconut milk, stir well to combine
5. Cut tofu into 1-inch cubes and add to curry, along with diced bell peppers (2 cups)
6. Simmer for 12-15 minutes until peppers are tender and curry is fragrant
7. Season with salt and pepper to taste
8. Stir in fresh cilantro (3 tablespoons) and epazote (1 tablespoon) just before serving
9. Serve over rice with lime wedges and sliced avocado on the side

recipes.name: Italian Tomato and Garlic Soup with Crispy Tortilla Croutons
recipes.description: A simple, elegant Italian-style tomato soup infused with garlic, fresh cilantro, and finished with extra virgin olive oil. Topped with crispy corn tortilla strips for texture.
recipes.ingredients_available: tomatoes (6 large), garlic (4 cloves), onion (1 medium), vegetable broth (6 cups), corn tortillas (2-3), extra virgin olive oil, salt, pepper, fresh cilantro (1/2 cup), lime (2)
recipes.ingredients_needed: Fresh basil (1/2 cup), Parmesan cheese (optional, 1/2 cup)
recipes.reason: Classic Italian preparation; uses abundant tomatoes and garlic you have; crispy tortilla element adds unique texture and uses your corn tortillas creatively.
recipes.instructions:
1. Heat 3 tablespoons olive oil in a large pot over medium heat
2. Dice onion (1 medium) and garlic (4 cloves), sauté for 3 minutes until softened
3. Add diced tomatoes (6 cups) and vegetable broth (6 cups), bring to a simmer
4. Simmer for 15 minutes to allow flavors to meld
5. While soup simmers, cut corn tortillas into thin strips and fry in 2 tablespoons olive oil at 350°F for 3-4 minutes until crispy; drain on paper towels
6. Blend soup using an immersion blender until smooth (or use a regular blender in batches)
7. Season with salt and pepper to taste
8. Stir in fresh basil (1/4 cup) and cilantro (3 tablespoons)
9. Ladle into bowls, top with crispy tortilla strips, fresh basil, and a drizzle of extra virgin olive oil
10. Serve with lime wedges on the side

recipes.name: Thai-Inspired Jalapeño and Lime Avocado Salad with Crispy Tortillas
recipes.description: A fusion dinner salad combining Thai lime-cilantro dressing with creamy avocado, roasted garlic, and crispy corn tortilla shards for crunch and substance.
recipes.ingredients_available: avocado (2), fresh cilantro (1/2 cup), lime (2), garlic (4 cloves), onion (1 medium), jalapeño (1), corn tortillas (2-3), extra virgin olive oil, salt, pepper, tomatoes (2 large)
recipes.ingredients_needed: Mixed greens or spinach (4 cups), sesame seeds (2 tablespoons), soy sauce or tamari (2 tablespoons)
recipes.reason: Thai flavors (lime, cilantro, jalapeño) meet salad format for lighter dinner; uses your fresh ingredients creatively; different from your recent soup preparation.
recipes.instructions:
1. Cut corn tortillas into strips and fry in 2 tablespoons olive oil at 350°F for 3-4 minutes until crispy; drain and set aside
2. Roast garlic cloves (4) in a dry pan over medium heat for 4-5 minutes until golden and fragrant; remove and roughly chop
3. In a bowl, whisk together juice of 2 limes, 3 tablespoons olive oil, minced jalapeño (1), minced garlic (2 cloves), 2 tablespoons soy sauce, and salt/pepper
4. Stir in fresh cilantro (1/4 cup) into dressing
5. Place mixed greens (4 cups) in a large bowl and toss with half the dressing
6. Arrange on plates and top with sliced avocado (2), diced tomato (2 cups), roasted garlic cloves, and crispy tortilla strips
7. Drizzle remaining dressing over the top
8. Sprinkle with sesame seeds (2 tablespoons) and remaining cilantro
9. Serve immediately

recipes.name: Italian Pasta e Fagioli-Style Vegetable Soup with Cilantro and Lime
recipes.description: A hearty Italian-inspired vegetable soup combining tomatoes, garlic, onion, and fresh herbs, finished with a cilantro-lime twist and crispy tortilla accompaniment.
recipes.ingredients_available: tomatoes (4 large), garlic (4 cloves), onion (1 medium), vegetable broth (6 cups), extra virgin olive oil, salt, pepper, fresh cilantro (1/2 cup), lime (2), corn tortillas (2-3), jalapeño (1)
recipes.ingredients_needed: Pasta (ditalini or small shells, 1 cup), canned white beans (2 cans), fresh basil (1/4 cup), red pepper flakes (1 teaspoon)
recipes.reason: Italian classic preparation with fresh herb accents; hearty and satisfying dinner; uses your broth, tomatoes, and fresh ingredients; different texture from recent soup.
recipes.instructions:
1. Heat 3 tablespoons olive oil in a large pot over medium heat
2. Dice onion (1 medium) and garlic (4 cloves), sauté for 3 minutes until softened
3. Add diced tomatoes (4 cups), vegetable broth (6 cups), and bring to a simmer
4. Add 2 cans white beans (drained and rinsed) and 1 teaspoon red pepper flakes
5. Simmer for 10 minutes to allow flavors to combine
6. Stir in pasta (1 cup) and cook for 8-10 minutes until al dente
7. Season with salt and pepper to taste
8. Stir in fresh basil (1/4 cup) and cilantro (3 tablespoons)
9. Finish with juice of 1 lime and a generous drizzle of extra virgin olive oil
10. Serve with crispy tortilla strips and lime wedges on the side

recipes.name: Thai Green Curry Vegetable Soup
recipes.description: A fragrant and creamy Thai-inspired soup combining your green curry paste with fresh vegetables and aromatic herbs. This light yet satisfying dinner offers a completely different flavor profile from your recent tortilla soup.
recipes.ingredients_available: garlic (4 cloves), onion (1 medium), tomatoes (6 large or 2 28oz cans), jalapeño (1), fresh cilantro (1/2 cup chopped), lime (1)
recipes.ingredients_needed: Coconut milk (1 can or 1.5 cups), spinach or bok choy (4-5 cups)
recipes.reason: Uses your green curry paste that pairs perfectly with soup, offers Asian cuisine variety from your recent Mexican meal, and utilizes most of your fresh ingredients with minimal shopping needed.
recipes.instructions:
1. Dice the onion and mince the garlic cloves.
2. Heat 2 tbsp olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add diced onion and cook for 3 minutes until softened.
3. Add minced garlic and cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
4. Stir in 3-4 tbsp green curry paste and cook for 2 minutes, stirring constantly.
5. Add 6 cups vegetable broth and bring to a simmer.
6. Chop tomatoes and add to pot along with 1 can coconut milk. Simmer for 8 minutes.
7. Slice the jalapeño and add to soup. Add 4-5 cups fresh spinach or bok choy and simmer for 3 minutes until wilted.
8. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
9. Squeeze juice from 1 lime into the soup. Ladle into bowls and garnish with fresh cilantro and lime wedges.

recipes.name: Rustic Tomato & Avocado Soup with Tortilla Strips
recipes.description: A velvety tomato-based soup finished with fresh lime and topped with crispy tortilla strips and creamy avocado. This Mexican-inspired comfort soup provides a lighter, fresher take than your previous tortilla soup while reusing familiar ingredients.
recipes.ingredients_available: tomatoes (6 large or 2 28oz cans), garlic (4 cloves), onion (1 medium), jalapeño (1), fresh cilantro (1/2 cup chopped), lime (1), avocado (2), corn tortillas (6-8), epazote (2 tbsp fresh)
recipes.reason: Uses nearly all your fresh ingredients (minimizing waste), creates a lighter variation from your rated 5/5 tortilla soup while staying in the same flavor family, and provides a complete dinner using what you already have in stock.
recipes.instructions:
1. Dice the onion and mince the garlic cloves.
2. Cut tortillas into thin strips. Heat 2 tbsp olive oil in a small skillet over medium-high heat. Fry tortilla strips in batches for 2-3 minutes until crispy and golden. Set aside on paper towels and sprinkle with salt.
3. In a large pot, heat 2 tbsp olive oil over medium heat. Add diced onion and cook for 4 minutes until softened.
4. Add minced garlic and sliced jalapeño; cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
5. Add chopped tomatoes and 6 cups vegetable broth. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 12 minutes.
6. Using an immersion blender, puree soup until smooth (or carefully transfer to blender in batches).
7. Return to pot if blended separately. Season with salt, pepper, and squeeze in juice from 1 lime.
8. Stir in fresh epazote (2 tbsp) just before serving.
9. Ladle into bowls. Top with crispy tortilla strips, diced avocado, fresh cilantro, and serve with lime wedges.

recipes.name: Lemon and Caper Pasta with Garlic and Tomatoes
recipes.description: A bright, zesty Italian pasta dish featuring fresh lemon juice and briny capers tossed with al dente pasta, garlic, and tomatoes for a simple yet elegant dinner.
recipes.ingredients_available: tomatoes (6 large or 2 28oz cans), garlic (4 cloves), lime (can substitute for lemon), fresh cilantro (1/2 cup chopped)
recipes.ingredients_needed: Fresh lemon (2-3), pasta (1 lb), capers (2-3 tbsp)
recipes.reason: Matches your Italian pasta preference with lemon and capers; uses most available ingredients and requires minimal additional shopping.
recipes.instructions:
1. Bring a large pot of salted water to boil and cook 1 lb pasta according to package directions until al dente; reserve 1 cup pasta water before draining.
2. While pasta cooks, heat 3 tbsp extra virgin olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
3. Mince 4 garlic cloves and add to hot oil, stirring constantly for 30 seconds until fragrant.
4. Add 6 large diced tomatoes (or 2 28oz cans, drained) and 2-3 tbsp capers to the skillet; simmer 8-10 minutes.
5. Stir in juice from 2-3 fresh lemons and season with salt and pepper to taste.
6. Add cooked pasta to the skillet and toss, adding pasta water as needed for a light sauce consistency (about 1/4-1/2 cup).
7. Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve immediately with extra lemon wedges.

recipes.name: Indian Aloo Gobi (Potato and Cauliflower Curry)
recipes.description: A classic vegetarian Indian dish featuring potatoes and cauliflower in a fragrant, spiced tomato-based curry with warming cumin, turmeric, and ginger.
recipes.ingredients_available: tomatoes (6 large or 2 28oz cans), onion (1 medium), garlic (4 cloves), fresh cilantro (1/2 cup chopped)
recipes.ingredients_needed: Potatoes (3-4 medium), cauliflower (1 medium head), fresh ginger (2 tbsp grated)
recipes.reason: Directly matches your aloo gobi request; uses available tomatoes, onion, and garlic with minimal fresh ingredient shopping.
recipes.instructions:
1. Peel and cut 3-4 medium potatoes into 1-inch cubes and chop 1 medium head of cauliflower into florets; set aside.
2. Heat 3 tbsp oil in a large pot over medium-high heat.
3. Dice 1 medium onion and add to oil; cook 5-6 minutes until softened and lightly golden.
4. Mince 4 garlic cloves and 2 tbsp fresh ginger; add to onions and cook 1-2 minutes until fragrant.
5. Stir in 2 tsp cumin seeds, 1 tsp turmeric powder, and 1 tsp coriander; toast for 30 seconds.
6. Add 6 diced tomatoes (or 2 28oz cans, drained) and cook 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
7. Add potato and cauliflower pieces with 1 tsp salt; stir well to coat with spices.
8. Add 1 cup vegetable broth, bring to simmer, cover and cook 20-25 minutes until vegetables are tender.
9. Adjust salt and pepper to taste; garnish with fresh cilantro and serve with rice or bread.

recipes.name: Potato and Leek Soup with Garlic and Herbs
recipes.description: A creamy, comforting French-inspired soup combining tender potatoes and leeks with garlic and herbs, finished with a drizzle of olive oil and fresh cilantro.
recipes.ingredients_available: onion (1 medium, can substitute), garlic (4 cloves), fresh cilantro (1/2 cup chopped)
recipes.ingredients_needed: Potatoes (4-5 medium), leeks (2-3 large)
recipes.reason: Matches your soup and French comfort food preferences; uses available garlic and pantry staples with minimal fresh ingredient additions.
recipes.instructions:
1. Clean 2-3 large leeks by slicing lengthwise and rinsing between layers; slice into half-moons.
2. Peel and cube 4-5 medium potatoes into 1-inch pieces.
3. Heat 2 tbsp extra virgin olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.
4. Add sliced leeks and cook 6-8 minutes, stirring occasionally, until softened.
5. Mince 4 garlic cloves and add to pot; cook 1 minute until fragrant.
6. Add cubed potatoes and 6 cups vegetable broth; bring to boil.
7. Reduce heat and simmer 15-20 minutes until potatoes are very tender.
8. Using an immersion blender, blend soup until desired consistency (partially chunky or completely smooth); alternatively, mash potatoes with a fork for rustic texture.
9. Season with salt, white pepper, and fresh thyme to taste.
10. Serve hot with a drizzle of olive oil, fresh cilantro, and cracked black pepper.

recipes.name: Doenjiang Jjigae (Korean Soybean Paste Stew)
recipes.description: A warming Korean soybean paste stew featuring vegetables and soft tofu in a rich, umami-forward broth seasoned with doenjiang (fermented soybean paste).
recipes.ingredients_available: tomatoes (6 large or 2 28oz cans), onion (1 medium), garlic (4 cloves), jalapeño (1), fresh cilantro (1/2 cup chopped)
recipes.ingredients_needed: Firm tofu (1 block), zucchini (1-2 medium), mushrooms (4 oz), doenjiang paste (2-3 tbsp)
recipes.reason: Directly matches your doenjiang request; uses available vegetables (onion, garlic, jalapeño, tomatoes) with simple pantry additions.
recipes.instructions:
1. Heat 1 tbsp sesame oil in a large pot or heavy-bottomed bowl over medium-high heat.
2. Dice 1 medium onion and add to pot; cook 3-4 minutes until fragrant and slightly softened.
3. Mince 4 garlic cloves and add to onions; stir for 30 seconds.
4. Add 6 cups vegetable broth and bring to a boil.
5. While broth heats, dice 1 block firm tofu into 1/2-inch cubes, chop 1-2 zucchini into chunks, slice 4 oz mushrooms, and mince 1 jalapeño.
6. In a small bowl, dissolve 2-3 tbsp doenjiang paste with 2-3 tbsp warm broth to create a smooth paste.
7. Add zucchini and mushrooms to boiling broth; cook 3-4 minutes.
8. Stir in doenjiang mixture thoroughly so it dissolves evenly throughout the broth.
9. Add tofu cubes and minced jalapeño; simmer 5-7 minutes until flavors meld.
10. Dice 2-3 tomatoes and add to pot just before serving (or use canned tomatoes).
11. Season with salt to taste and serve hot in bowls, garnished with sliced green onions and sesame seeds if desired.

recipes.name: Thai Green Curry Soup with Vegetables
recipes.description: A fragrant Thai-inspired soup combining green curry paste with coconut milk and vegetables in a light vegetable broth base, finished with fresh lime and cilantro.
recipes.ingredients_available: green curry paste (from pantry), vegetable broth (6 cups), lime (1 of 2 available), onion (1 medium), garlic (4 cloves), jalapeño (1), fresh cilantro (1/2 cup chopped)
recipes.ingredients_needed: Coconut milk (1 can), bell pepper (1), mushrooms (4 oz), Thai basil or additional fresh herbs
recipes.reason: Uses your available green curry paste and vegetable broth from pantry; provides international variety from Korean and Indian dishes with minimal additional fresh ingredient needs.
recipes.instructions:
1. Heat 1 tbsp extra virgin olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.
2. Dice 1 medium onion and add to pot; cook 3-4 minutes until softened.
3. Mince 4 garlic cloves and add to onions; cook 1 minute.
4. Stir in 2-3 tbsp green curry paste, breaking it apart to distribute evenly; cook 1-2 minutes, stirring constantly.
5. Slowly pour in 1 can coconut milk while stirring to combine with curry paste.
6. Add 6 cups vegetable broth; bring to gentle simmer.
7. While soup simmers, slice 1 bell pepper into strips, slice 4 oz mushrooms, and mince 1 jalapeño.
8. Add pepper, mushrooms, and jalapeño to soup; simmer 8-10 minutes until vegetables are tender.
9. Squeeze juice from 1 lime into soup and season with salt to taste.
10. Serve hot, garnished generously with fresh cilantro and lime wedges on the side.
ingredients: Thai basil or additional fresh herbs

recipes.name: Pasta with Lemon, Capers, and Winter Vegetables
recipes.description: A bright, tangy Italian pasta dish featuring tender pasta tossed with preserved lemon, briny capers, and roasted winter vegetables for a light yet satisfying dinner.
recipes.ingredients_needed: Pasta, lemon, capers, carrots, celery, Brussels sprouts or winter squash, garlic, onion, fresh parsley
recipes.reason: Matches your specific request for pasta with lemon, capers, and winter vegetables; provides Italian cuisine variety without repeating your recent spicy soup
recipes.instructions:
1. Peel and chop 2 carrots, 2 celery stalks, 1 cup Brussels sprouts (halved), and 1 small onion into bite-sized pieces
2. Toss vegetables with 3 tablespoons olive oil, salt, and pepper on a baking sheet
3. Roast at 425°F for 20-25 minutes until caramelized and tender
4. Meanwhile, bring salted water to boil and cook 12 oz pasta according to package directions; drain and reserve 1 cup pasta water
5. Zest 2 lemons and juice them (about 6 tablespoons juice); mince 3 garlic cloves
6. In a large pan, heat 2 tablespoons olive oil over medium heat; sauté garlic for 1 minute until fragrant
7. Add cooked pasta, roasted vegetables, lemon juice, zest, and 3 tablespoons capers to the pan
8. Toss well, adding pasta water 1/4 cup at a time until sauce coats pasta (you may not need all of it)
9. Season with salt and pepper to taste; garnish with fresh parsley and serve immediately

recipes.name: Indian Potato and Chickpea Curry (Aloo Chana Masala)
recipes.description: A warming, fragrant Indian curry combining tender potatoes and chickpeas in a spiced tomato-based sauce, perfect for a satisfying vegetarian dinner.
recipes.ingredients_needed: Potatoes, chickpeas (canned or dried), onion, garlic, ginger, tomatoes (canned), coconut milk
recipes.reason: Directly matches your request for an Indian potato and chickpea curry; provides Indian cuisine as requested and varied meal type from recent soup
recipes.instructions:
1. Dice 1 lb potatoes into 1-inch cubes; mince 4 garlic cloves and 1 tablespoon fresh ginger
2. Dice 1 large onion; drain and rinse 2 cans (15 oz each) chickpeas
3. Heat 3 tablespoons oil in a large pot over medium-high heat; add onion and cook 5 minutes until softened
4. Add garlic and ginger; cook 2 minutes until fragrant
5. Stir in 2 teaspoons cumin, 2 teaspoons coriander, 1 teaspoon turmeric, 1/2 teaspoon cayenne pepper, and 1/2 teaspoon paprika; toast for 1 minute
6. Add potatoes and stir to coat with spices; cook 3 minutes
7. Pour in 1 can (14.5 oz) diced tomatoes with juice and 1 cup coconut milk; stir well
8. Bring to simmer, cover, and cook 20 minutes until potatoes are tender
9. Add chickpeas and cook uncovered 5 more minutes; season with salt and pepper
10. Serve with rice or naan bread

recipes.name: Doenjiang Jjigae (Korean Soybean Paste Stew)
recipes.description: A traditional Korean comfort stew made with earthy doenjiang (soybean paste), silky tofu, and vegetables in a rich, umami-packed broth.
recipes.ingredients_needed: Firm tofu, doenjiang (Korean soybean paste), onion, garlic, zucchini, potato, mushrooms (shiitake or cremini), green chili pepper, scallions
recipes.reason: Directly matches your request for doenjiang; provides Korean cuisine variety and introduces a traditional comfort dish different from recent meals
recipes.instructions:
1. Dice 14 oz firm tofu into 1-inch cubes; peel and dice 1 potato; dice 1 medium onion
2. Mince 4 garlic cloves; slice 1 medium zucchini; slice 8 oz mushrooms; seed and slice 1 green chili pepper
3. Chop 3 scallions, separating white and green parts
4. Bring 4 cups vegetable broth to boil in a large pot or stone bowl (if available)
5. Add onion and cook 2 minutes; add garlic and cook 1 minute until fragrant
6. Add diced potato and mushrooms; simmer 8-10 minutes until potato begins to soften
7. Stir 3 tablespoons doenjiang (soybean paste) into a small bowl with 1/4 cup warm broth to dissolve; pour into pot
8. Add tofu cubes, zucchini, and white parts of scallions; simmer 8-10 minutes
9. Top with green chili pepper slices and green scallion parts; add a drizzle of sesame oil if desired
10. Serve hot in individual bowls with rice on the side

recipes.name: Creamy Potato and Leek Soup
recipes.description: A classic, velvety soup combining tender potatoes and mild leeks in a creamy broth, finished with fresh herbs for a comforting dinner.
recipes.ingredients_needed: Potatoes, leeks, onion, garlic, vegetable broth, heavy cream or coconut milk, fresh thyme, fresh parsley
recipes.reason: Directly matches your request for potato and leek soup; provides soup cuisine variety and classic comfort dish suited for dinner without repeating your recent spicy soup
recipes.instructions:
1. Clean leeks thoroughly: slice white and light green parts only into 1/4-inch rounds (about 3 cups)
2. Peel and dice 1.5 lbs potatoes into 1-inch cubes; dice 1/2 onion; mince 3 garlic cloves
3. Heat 3 tablespoons butter or olive oil in a large pot over medium heat
4. Add sliced leeks and diced onion; cook 8-10 minutes, stirring occasionally, until very soft and fragrant
5. Add garlic and cook 1-2 minutes more until fragrant
6. Add diced potatoes and 6 cups vegetable broth; bring to boil
7. Reduce heat and simmer 15-20 minutes until potatoes are very tender
8. Blend soup until smooth using an immersion blender, or carefully transfer to blender in batches
9. Stir in 1 cup heavy cream or coconut milk and 1 teaspoon fresh thyme (or 1/2 teaspoon dried)
10. Season with salt and pepper to taste; garnish with fresh parsley and serve hot

recipes.name: Minestrone Soup with Winter Vegetables
recipes.description: A hearty Italian vegetable and pasta soup loaded with seasonal winter vegetables, beans, and aromatics in a tomato-based broth.
recipes.ingredients_needed: Carrots, celery, onion, garlic, canned tomatoes, vegetable broth, green beans or zucchini, spinach or kale, white beans (canned), small pasta (ditalini or elbow)
recipes.reason: Provides soup cuisine variety with a different style than your recent spicy tortilla soup; uses easily accessible winter vegetables and is perfect for a comforting Italian dinner
recipes.instructions:
1. Dice 2 carrots, 2 celery stalks, 1 large onion; mince 4 garlic cloves
2. Trim 1 cup green beans and cut into 1-inch pieces; chop 2 cups fresh spinach or kale; drain 1 can (15 oz) white beans
3. Heat 3 tablespoons olive oil in a large pot over medium heat
4. Add onion, carrots, and celery; cook 8-10 minutes until softened
5. Add garlic and cook 1 minute until fragrant
6. Stir in 1 can (28 oz) crushed tomatoes, 6 cups vegetable broth, 1 teaspoon Italian seasoning, and salt and pepper to taste
7. Bring to boil, then reduce heat and simmer 10 minutes
8. Add green beans, white beans, and pasta; simmer 12-15 minutes until pasta is tender
9. Stir in fresh spinach or kale and cook 2-3 minutes until wilted
10. Taste and adjust seasoning; serve hot with crusty bread or grated Parmesan

recipes.name: Korean Vegetable and Tofu Bibimbap with Gochujang Sauce
recipes.description: A vibrant Korean mixed rice bowl topped with seasoned vegetables, crispy fried tofu, a fried egg, and spicy gochujang sauce served over warm rice.
recipes.ingredients_needed: Short-grain rice, firm tofu, egg, shiitake mushrooms, spinach, carrots, zucchini, bean sprouts, scallions, gochujang (Korean red chili paste), sesame seeds
recipes.reason: Provides Korean cuisine variety different from the doenjiang stew; offers a visually appealing, complete meal with multiple components and textures for dinner
recipes.instructions:
1. Cook 2 cups short-grain rice according to package directions; keep warm
2. Press 14 oz firm tofu between paper towels with weight for 15 minutes; cut into 1/2-inch thick slabs
3. Slice 8 oz mushrooms; julienne 2 carrots; slice 1 medium zucchini lengthwise then into matchsticks; chop 2 cups spinach; chop 2 cups bean sprouts; chop 3 scallions
4. Heat 2 tablespoons oil in a skillet over medium-high heat; pan-fry tofu slices 4-5 minutes per side until golden; set aside and cut into bite-sized pieces
5. In same skillet, sauté mushrooms with a pinch of salt and 1/2 teaspoon sesame oil for 4 minutes; transfer to a bowl
6. Sauté carrots and zucchini together for 4 minutes with salt; transfer to separate bowl
7. Sauté spinach with 1/2 teaspoon sesame oil and a pinch of salt for 2 minutes; transfer to bowl
8. Sauté bean sprouts with salt and 1/2 teaspoon sesame oil for 2 minutes; transfer to bowl
9. In a small bowl, whisk 3 tablespoons gochujang with 2 tablespoons sesame oil, 1 tablespoon rice vinegar, 1 teaspoon sugar, and 1 minced garlic clove to make sauce
10. Divide warm rice among bowls; arrange vegetables and tofu on top in sections; fry 1 egg per bowl sunny-side up; top with egg, gochujang sauce, and sesame seeds

recipes.name: Pasta with Lemon, Capers & Winter Vegetables
recipes.description: A bright, tangy Italian pasta dish featuring zesty lemon and briny capers paired with roasted winter vegetables for a light yet satisfying dinner. This fresh-flavored pasta celebrates simple, quality ingredients.
recipes.ingredients_needed: Pasta, lemon, capers, garlic, onion, carrots, celery, Brussels sprouts (or kale), fresh parsley
recipes.reason: Directly matches your request for a pasta with lemon, capers, and winter vegetables in an Italian style.
recipes.instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 425°F. Chop 2 cups Brussels sprouts, 2 carrots, and 2 celery stalks into bite-sized pieces.
2. Toss vegetables with 3 tablespoons olive oil, salt, and pepper. Roast for 20 minutes until golden and tender.
3. Bring a large pot of salted water to boil and cook 1 pound pasta according to package directions (about 9-12 minutes). Reserve 1 cup pasta water before draining.
4. Mince 4 garlic cloves and finely chop 1 small onion.
5. In a large skillet, heat 2 tablespoons olive oil over medium heat. Sauté garlic and onion for 3-4 minutes until fragrant.
6. Add roasted vegetables to the skillet along with 3 tablespoons capers (drained), zest of 2 lemons, and juice of 1.5 lemons.
7. Toss in cooked pasta and mix well, adding pasta water 1/4 cup at a time until creamy (you may not need all of it).
8. Season with salt, pepper, and red pepper flakes to taste. Garnish with 2 tablespoons fresh parsley and serve.

recipes.name: Indian Aloo Chana (Potato & Chickpea Curry)
recipes.description: A hearty and aromatic Indian curry combining tender potatoes and chickpeas in a spiced tomato-based sauce. This comforting dish is rich in protein and perfectly suited for a warming dinner.
recipes.ingredients_needed: Potatoes, chickpeas (canned or dried/cooked), tomatoes (canned or fresh), onion, garlic, ginger, green chilies
recipes.reason: Directly matches your request for an Indian potato and chickpea curry for dinner.
recipes.instructions:
1. Heat 2 tablespoons oil in a large pot over medium heat. Dice 1 large onion and add to the pot, cooking for 5-6 minutes until golden.
2. Add 4 minced garlic cloves and 1 tablespoon minced fresh ginger, cooking for 1 minute until fragrant.
3. Add 2 teaspoons cumin, 1.5 teaspoons coriander, 1 teaspoon turmeric, and 1 teaspoon paprika. Stir constantly for 30 seconds to bloom the spices.
4. Add 1 can (14 oz) diced tomatoes with their juices and 1 diced green chili. Cook for 3-4 minutes.
5. Dice 1.5 pounds potatoes into 1-inch cubes and add to the pot along with 2 cans (15 oz each) chickpeas (drained and rinsed).
6. Pour in 1 cup water and bring to a simmer. Cook covered for 20-25 minutes until potatoes are very tender.
7. Stir in 1 teaspoon garam masala and 1/2 teaspoon salt (adjust to taste). Simmer for 2 more minutes.
8. Finish with juice of 1/2 lime and fresh cilantro if available. Serve with rice or naan.

recipes.name: Korean Doenjang-jjigae (Soybean Paste Stew)
recipes.description: A traditional Korean comfort stew featuring salty, umami-rich soybean paste with tofu, vegetables, and aromatic broth. This warming soup is a staple of Korean home cooking and deeply satisfying.
recipes.ingredients_needed: Doenjang (Korean soybean paste), tofu, potatoes, onion, garlic, zucchini, mushrooms (shiitake or button), green onions, gochugaru (Korean red chili flakes, optional)
recipes.reason: Directly matches your request for a doenjang (Korean soybean paste stew) for dinner.
recipes.instructions:
1. Cut 14 oz firm tofu into 1/2-inch cubes and set aside.
2. Dice 1 medium potato, 1/2 onion, 3 garlic cloves, 1 medium zucchini, and slice 4 oz mushrooms.
3. Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a large pot over medium heat. Sauté onion and garlic for 2-3 minutes until fragrant.
4. Add diced potato and 4 cups water. Bring to a boil and cook for 8-10 minutes until potatoes soften.
5. In a small bowl, mix 3 tablespoons doenjang with 1/4 cup hot broth until smooth paste forms. Stir this mixture into the pot.
6. Add zucchini, mushrooms, and tofu cubes. Simmer for 5-7 minutes until vegetables are tender.
7. Add 1 teaspoon sesame oil, salt and pepper to taste, and 1/2 teaspoon gochugaru if desired.
8. Serve in bowls, garnishing with sliced green onions and a drizzle of sesame oil.

recipes.name: Creamy Potato & Leek Soup
recipes.description: A classic French-inspired soup featuring tender potatoes and sweet leeks in a silky, comforting broth. This elegant yet simple soup is perfect for a sophisticated dinner.
recipes.ingredients_needed: Leeks, potatoes, vegetable broth (or water), onion, garlic, fresh thyme, bay leaf, cream or milk (optional)
recipes.reason: Directly matches your request for a potato and leek soup for dinner.
recipes.instructions:
1. Clean 3 large leeks by slicing lengthwise, rinsing between layers, then slicing into 1/2-inch half-moons.
2. Dice 1 pound potatoes into 1/2-inch cubes. Dice 1/2 onion and mince 3 garlic cloves.
3. Heat 2 tablespoons olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Sauté onion and leeks for 6-8 minutes, stirring occasionally, until softened.
4. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
5. Add diced potatoes, 4 cups vegetable broth (or water), 1 bay leaf, and 2-3 sprigs fresh thyme. Bring to a boil.
6. Reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes until potatoes are very tender.
7. Remove bay leaf and thyme sprigs. For a rustic texture, mash some potatoes in the pot with a wooden spoon. For a smooth soup, blend until desired consistency using an immersion blender.
8. Stir in 1/2 cup cream or milk if desired, season with salt and pepper to taste, and serve hot.

recipes.name: Indian Spinach & Tomato Dal (Lentil Soup)
recipes.description: A vibrant and nutritious Indian lentil soup combining red lentils, spinach, and tomatoes in an aromatic spiced broth. This protein-rich soup is both comforting and nourishing.
recipes.ingredients_needed: Red lentils, spinach (fresh or frozen), tomatoes (canned or fresh), onion, garlic, ginger, cumin seeds, mustard seeds
recipes.reason: Provides another Indian soup option that complements your requested aloo chana curry while offering different flavors and textures.
recipes.instructions:
1. Rinse 1 cup red lentils thoroughly under cold water until water runs clear.
2. Heat 2 tablespoons oil in a large pot over medium-high heat. Add 1 teaspoon cumin seeds and 1/2 teaspoon mustard seeds, cooking for 1 minute until they pop and crackle.
3. Dice 1 large onion and add to the pot, cooking for 5 minutes until golden.
4. Add 4 minced garlic cloves and 1 tablespoon minced fresh ginger, cooking for 1 minute.
5. Stir in 1 teaspoon turmeric and 1/2 teaspoon cayenne pepper, cooking for 30 seconds.
6. Add the rinsed lentils, 1 can (14 oz) diced tomatoes, and 4 cups water. Bring to a boil.
7. Reduce heat and simmer for 15-18 minutes until lentils are completely soft and breaking down.
8. Add 3 cups fresh spinach (or 1 cup frozen) and stir until wilted, about 2-3 minutes.
9. Season with salt and juice of 1 lime. Serve with rice or bread.

recipes.name: Tuscan White Bean & Kale Soup
recipes.description: A rustic Italian soup featuring creamy white beans, hearty kale, and aromatic vegetables in a herb-infused broth. This warming dinner is simple yet deeply satisfying.
recipes.ingredients_needed: Cannellini beans (canned or dried/cooked), kale, carrots, celery, onion, garlic, tomatoes (canned), vegetable broth, fresh rosemary
recipes.reason: Provides an Italian soup option that offers variety from your other meal choices while being hearty and suitable for dinner.
recipes.instructions:
1. Heat 3 tablespoons olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.
2. Dice 1 onion, 2 carrots, and 2 celery stalks. Mince 4 garlic cloves.
3. Add onion, carrots, and celery to the pot, cooking for 6-7 minutes until softened.
4. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
5. Stir in 1 can (14 oz) diced tomatoes, 2 cans (15 oz each) cannellini beans (drained and rinsed), 4 cups vegetable broth, and 2 sprigs fresh rosemary.
6. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes.
7. Chop 4 cups fresh kale (remove tough stems), removing any tough center ribs, and add to the pot.
8. Simmer for 8-10 minutes until kale is tender. Remove rosemary sprigs.
9. Season with salt, pepper, and a splash of balsamic vinegar. Serve with crusty bread.
